website_summaries.verdict: A warm and comfortable jacket that layers well.
pros: This mid-temperature jacket is great on its own or layered
Either way, it will keep you warm and and protect you from moisture with its durable water repellent finish
cons: Doesn't stand up to cold weather on its own

customer_reviews.title: Light and Surprisingly Warm
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of this brand, and this Atom LT jacket does not disappoint. It's no-kidding, light as a feather, and somehow effective for me with nothing but a t-shirt underneath in temperatures down to about 25 degrees. The fit is slim, and would not allow much in terms of layers underneath, so not a true long-duration solution in extreme temps.
customer_reviews.author: TCB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I own several jackets of respected brands such as North Face, Patagonia and Ibex. This one exceeded all of them. I am surprised by lightness and warmth. I feel like it's my second skin. So comfortable to wear. After just one day I decided to order vest in the same model. I like the color too. Pilot is very elegant and neutral looking great with many pieces of my wardrobe. Very happy. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C.Wisniowski

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket if the size and price are right
customer_reviews.text: For an activity jacket in midrange temperatures, this is a good bet. Keep in mind that the light insulation is strategically placed and the side panels are venting. That is, this is better used for strenuous hiking than sitting in a stadium to watch a late fall football game. The weight is minimal and it compresses for packing. In the right size (one up for me), it clings but doesn't restrict movement. The coverage is good. The materials and workmanship are of good quality. It's a nice athletic jacket but you need to find a discounted price to get the value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Henry E. Dorfman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. I dont want to take it off
customer_reviews.text: I do not want to this jacket off. Its amazingly comfortable. I initially purchased this because my down jacket was too hot, and got a funky with repeated wearings. This jacket breathes incredibly well, super warm, stylish, and above all comfortable
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Go to jacket.
customer_reviews.text: Warm when you are stationary and the vents cool you off when you are active. I always overheat in my down jacket and this has become my go to. If you need room for layering make sure you size up as this is more of an athletic fit. Arcteryx makes quality stuff. Cheaper than the Patagonia nanopuff too.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket
customer_reviews.text: Thus is the second Arcteryx jacket that I have owned and it is a good and quality jacket. It will look good if you have a slim and athletic body. I wish they are a bit cheaper so I can buy more. Arcteryx jackets are relatively more expensive than others.
customer_reviews.author: Leftcoast

customer_reviews.title: Amazing technology
customer_reviews.text: The technology in this is truly amazing. Featherlite but perfect for those 40-60 degree days. Incredible wind resistance and breathability as well. It is my go to city jacket for those tweener weather days. Would prefer that it be slightly more packable and seems like it might not hold up to tearing if hiking but like I said, truly great for urban and active commute.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Jacket
customer_reviews.text: This light weight jacket has an awesome warmth to weight to comfort ratio. This jacket is also very nice looking as well. I have several ArcTeryx products in my closet, and this is just another example of ArcTeryx's fine apparel engineering for a hybrid of active and casual life styles.
customer_reviews.author: Breview

customer_reviews.title: Too billowy
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, it fits loosely in the abdomen now to fit a fatter and fatter population, but other than that, it's a great jacket.

customer_reviews.title: The jacket you've been looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is one of the warmest jackets I have ever owned. I have worn this in 15° weather by itself. If you add a hard shell, you have your own micro climate. It is truly mind boggling how well this jacket preforms

customer_reviews.title: Nice underarm stretch inserts

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, lightweight but still warm

customer_reviews.title: Great product

customer_reviews.title: Arc'teryx Go To Lightweight Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight jacket for mid 50's to 60's warmth...it can handle a certain amount of both wind and light sprinkles. Great mid-layer jacket in really sub 30's weather....Very well made and comfortable.

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight mid

customer_reviews.title: and comfortable. I bought it to be used as a ...

customer_reviews.title: Amazing jacket
customer_reviews.text: Was originally shopping for a fleece jacket. This is a really nice substitute. Good insulation and very light. I am 5"9' 170 lb and medium fits snugly but just right.

customer_reviews.title: Perfection.

I just want to quickly add to the hype and say that this jacket is even beyond what I expected. It is nothing short of outstanding. I won't lie, I even let out a giddy schoolgirl "Eek!" the moment I slipped it on. This is my first Arc'teryx product but I can guarantee it won't be my last. Kudos to you, Arc'teryx.

customer_reviews.title: My Second Atom Jacket
customer_reviews.text: I'm obsessed with Arcteryx. This brand is amazing. I want it all. I have the Atom AR Hoody and loved it so much last winter that I needed it's little cool weather companion. The Atom LT will be my go-to for dry 40-50 degree days. I'll probably break out the Atom AR for days in the 30s or below, pairing with some fleece layering underneath for < 20 degrees.

customer_reviews.title: Easily my favorite go to jacket
customer_reviews.text: Easily my favorite go to jacket. Always been a Northface fan and still have plenty of their products but after some recommendation, decided to see what Arcteryx was about. My first purchase was an Atom SL. Loved it for running or use as a windbreaker. With Iowa's unpredictable seasons I decided to get the Atom LT. Perfect for spring/fall...and with the right layers Winter even. I've noticed Arcteryx jackets are very light and very packable but still plenty warm. Slightly steep price tag but the quality makes it worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: A.Lov

customer_reviews.title: It's breathable enough that when your active it vents heat under your arms while remaining almost wind proof and great down to 4
customer_reviews.text: Where can I start? I spend 200 days a year traveling and encounter all kinds of crazy weather. It's breathable enough that when your active it vents heat under your arms while remaining almost wind proof and great down to 40 or so. Packs very small. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Jon Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight and warm!
customer_reviews.text: The Medium fit very well, I'm 5'10" and weigh 153 lbs. The cut is athletic/slim, so if you have a big stomach, that could be a problem. I live in Los Angeles, and this is perfect for my winter 5AM walks. I especially like its lack of bulk, just a bit more than a winter shirt, and is easy to pack, or wear in the house when the heater is off.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Cut too slim
customer_reviews.text: I have an Atom LT vest that I love. I needed a new puff jacket to replace an old favorite and order the same size. This jacket runs slim with long sleeves. I knew the sleeves run long from other reviews, but this is cut slimmer than the vest. I'm 5'8' 170 pounds with wider shoulders than normal (42" chest). The large was too tight through the lats and shoulders and I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Not much to it
customer_reviews.text: For the cost of the jacket, I was extremely disappointed in the lack of material. I knew it would be bad when the jacket fit in a large envelope. It’s more of a windbreaker than anything else.

product_meta.title: Arc'teryx mens Atom Lt Jacket
product_meta.description: The Atom LT Jacket from Arc'teryx functions perfectly as an outer layer when times are cool and dry, but functions just as well as a mid layer in those chilly and wet conditions. This jacket offers Coreloft insulation to keep you super warm, but also offers permeable sides to allow for some airflow if things heat up; aside from that, the Atom LT Jacket will provide you with enough pockets for storing all of the essentials, and then some. Featuring an Arc'teryx logo on the chest and some nice dark colors makes the Atom LT Jacket stylish enough for any occasion. feature_bullets: Polartec Power Stretch with Hardface Technology—88% polyester, 12% elastane, 230 g/m². Coreloft 60 (60 g/m²) insulation. Tyono 20 denier shell with DWR treatment - 100% nylon.

ESSENTIAL PIECE - Fact: Every person at Head Office owns at least one Atom LT; most of the women have two. The reason: Coreloft insulation inside a light taffeta shell. All the comfort of a sleeping bag, but it feels weightless.

WINDSHELL - The benefit of taffeta fabrics is their light, airy nature with an ability to turn aside wind. The Atom series have a taffeta outer lining that is treated with DWR (durable water resistant) finish to give them a long-lasting ability to shed moisture. In light precipitation, the Atom LT can be worn as an outer layer.

NO SWEAT - Mid layers that can function as outer layers have varied degrees of weather shedding capability; they also have varied degrees of moisture management. In addition to being made of breathable Coreloft insulation, the Atom LT has breathable side panels of Polartec Power Stretch with Hardface technology to help regulate temperature during exertion.

PACK LIGHT - Highly compressible, Atom pieces pack down into a tiny parcel of stored warmth. Store the jacket inside its own pocket, or tuck it into a sleeve or inside the hood if you are not restricted by space. A quick shake restores the original loft, time and again.
